title: Showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that the prevailing dry weather condition on the island is expected to temporarily change on March 10 and 11.

title: Over 20 SSPs and OICs transferred with immediate effect
byline: The Police Headquarters has announced the transfer of more than 20 Senior Superintendents of Police (SSPs) and Officers-in-Charge (OICs), effective immediately, according to the Police Media Division.

title: Sri Lanka to introduce new low-priced alcohol to curb illicit liquor?
byline: The Excise Department of Sri Lanka has announced plans to introduce a new type of alcohol at a lower price to combat the growing consumption of illicit liquor.

title: PM Harini vows action against political interference in education
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the crises emerging within the education system are primarily due to the improper implementation of policies and political interference, and immediate actions will be taken to investigate the collection of funds in schools for various reasons.

title: Israel, Hamas signal readiness for next ceasefire talks as mediators push for progress
byline: Israel and Hamas signaled on Saturday they were preparing for the next phase of ceasefire negotiations, as mediators pushed ahead with talks to extend the fragile 42-day truce that began in January.

title: 2025 LG Elections: 18 parties, 57 independent groups place deposits
byline: The Election Commission has issued a statement regarding the political parties and independent groups that have placed their deposits thus far to contest the 2025 Local Government (LG) Elections.

title: Sumeda Ranasinghe sets new national record, qualifies for World Championships
byline: Sumeda Ranasinghe has a new national record in Javelin Throw and has now qualified to represent Sri Lanka at the next World Championships in Japan.

title: Police recover several illegal firearms in raids across the island
byline: Sri Lanka Police have recovered several illegal firearms from various areas of the island.

title: EX- IGP Deshabandu’s assets could be frozen if he continues to evade court – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala stated that if former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon continues to evade appearing before court, his movable and immovable assets can be frozen under a circular already issued by Acting IGP Priyantha Weerasuriya.

title: Adani wind power project not canceled yet - Power Minister
byline: Minister of Power, Kumara Jayakody, stated that the wind power project that was to be carried out with India’s Adani Group has not yet been canceled.

title: President reassures IMF chief of govt’s commitment to successfully complete remaining reviews under EFF
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held a highly productive virtual meeting with the Managing Director of the IMF, Ms. Kristalina Georgieva, yesterday (07), according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Google Doodle celebrates women in STEM on International Women’s day
byline: To celebrate this year’s International Women’s Day, Google is honouring the achievements of visionary women in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) fields with a special doodle.

title: 12 injured in shooting at Toronto pub
byline: At least 12 people were injured in a shooting at a pub in Toronto late Friday, police said, without providing a motive and adding the suspect was still at large.

title: Sri Lanka records over 500,000 tourist arrivals in first 2 months of 2025
byline: The total number of foreign tourists who have arrived in Sri Lanka in the first two months of 2025 has already surpassed 500,000, according to the latest data.

title: Actor Gene Hackman and wife Betsy Arakawa died of natural causes one week apart
byline: Forensic experts came to a heartrending conclusion Friday about the manner of death for actor Gene Hackman: he died of heart disease with complications from Alzheimer’s disease on an empty stomach a week after a rare, rodent-borne disease took the life of his wife at their home in Santa Fe.

title: ‘Major powers should not bully the weak’, China’s foreign minister says
byline: Beijing will “resolutely counter” U.S. pressure on tariffs and the fentanyl issue, China’s foreign minister said on Friday, adding that major powers “should not bully the weak”, in a veiled swipe at the Trump administration’s foreign policy.

title: Indian politician questions why Murali has been allotted land in Jammu’s Kathua
byline: CPI(M) MLA Muhammad Yousuf Tarigami has questioned the allotment of land to Sri Lankan cricket legend Muttiah Muralitharan in Kathua, during the ongoing budget session of the Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly on Saturday.

title: Two injured in shooting incident at Gampaha
byline: At least two persons have been injured and hospitalized following a shooting incident at Akarawita in Gampaha.

title: Bill to ban corporal punishment of children to be introduced soon – Justice Minister
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration Harshana Nanayakkara has announced that steps will be taken to swiftly pass a bill prohibiting the corporal punishment of children.
